org.intermine.bio.postprocess

Class OverlapUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.intermine.bio.postprocess.OverlapUtil

  • public abstract class OverlapUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility methods for finding overlaps.

    • Method Detail

      • createOverlaps

        public static void createOverlaps(ObjectStore os,
                  org.intermine.model.bio.SequenceFeature subject,
                  java.util.List<?> classNamesToIgnore,
                  boolean ignoreSelfMatches,
                  ObjectStoreWriter osw,
                  java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> summary)
                           throws ObjectStoreException,
                                  java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Creates OverlapRelations for overlapping SequenceFeature objects that are located on the given subject (generally a Chromosome).
        Parameters:
        os - the ObjectStore to query
        subject - the SequenceFeature (eg. a Chromosome) where the LSFs are located
        classNamesToIgnore - a List of the names of those classes that should be ignored when searching for overlaps. Sub classes to these classes are ignored too. In addition, an entry can be of the form class=class, which specifies that the particular combination should be ignored. Hence an entry of the form class is equivalent to class=InterMineObject
        ignoreSelfMatches - if true, don't create OverlapRelations between two objects of the same class
        osw - the ObjectStoreWriter to use to write to the database
        summary - a Map, to which summary data will be added
        Throws:
        ObjectStoreException - if an error occurs while writing
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if there is an ObjectStore problem

      • ignoreCombination

        protected static boolean ignoreCombination(java.util.Map<java.lang.Class<?>,java.util.Set<java.lang.Class<?>>> classesToIgnore,
                        java.lang.Class<?> class1,
                        java.lang.Class<?> class2)
        Return true if the given class should be ignored when overlapping with the other given class.
        Parameters:
        classesToIgnore - list of classes to ignore.
        class1 - first class to compare
        class2 - second class to compare
        Returns:
        Return true if the given class should be ignored when overlapping with the other given class.
